headline: Homebuyer Set to Take Over Solar Panel Lease for $900—Then Seller Slipped In $12K Fee Days Before Closing And Told Them 'Bake It Into the Loan'
summary: Buying a home with solar panels might sound eco-friendly and future-forward... until you're ambushed by a five-figure "surprise" the week of closing. In a post shared to the Real Estate subreddit, one homebuyer detailed how a seemingly straightforward ...

headline: This 25-Year-Old Is Torn Between Paying Off Student Loans and Investing — And Can't Decide Which Comes First
summary: Should you invest in the stock market or pay off debt? It depends on several factors, but one 25-year-old didn't want to guess. This individual turned to Reddit and asked if it makes more sense to pay off a student loan at 6% APR or start investing in their 401(k). Several Redditors offered their suggestions, but most of the comments had a few key details in common. Knowing how to tackle investments and loans is an important part of building wealth, and Redditors didn't disappoint in the comment
